Company Description

A Crane Team is an innovative IT consulting collective specializing in designing, securing, and optimizing digital ecosystems. We transform complex systems into scalable, efficient, and secure infrastructures, enabling businesses to thrive in a connected world. Our multidisciplinary team includes experts in application and system architecture, process optimization, security testing, and AI-driven innovation. At A Crane Team, we tackle enterprise challenges, modernize legacy technologies, and implement transformative solutions with precision and clarity.



Role Description

This is a contract-based, remote position for a Senior JavaScript Runtime Engineer. The engineer will be responsible for developing, optimizing, and securing JavaScript runtime systems. Day-to-day tasks include analyzing runtime performance, implementing runtime extensions, contributing to security measures, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of runtime solutions with existing architectures.



Qualifications

- Advanced proficiency in JavaScript, TypeScript, and runtime system design
- Hands-on experience with runtime optimization, debugging, and memory management tools
- Knowledge of runtime security practices and implementing secure runtime environments
- Experience in scalable architecture design, system performance testing, and deployment strategies
- Exceptional analytical skills, problem-solving capabilities, and attention to detail
- Experience collaborating with multidisciplinary teams in a remote environment
- Relevant certifications or experience with modern runtime frameworks is a plus
- Strong communication skills with the ability to convey complex concepts clearly

- Lead the design and delivery of complex, cross-team projects, ensuring the API is robust, scalable, and easy to integrate.
- Rapidly onboard to an existing, production-grade codebase, and help your team do the same.
- Shape architectural decisions that impact not just the Events team, but multiple teams across Algolia.
- Mentor engineers, helping them grow their technical skills and confidence while fostering a collaborative, high-trust culture. This role offers a unique opportunity for personal and professional growth.
- Remove bottlenecks and ensure the team operates without single points of failure.
- Work closely with product managers, frontend engineers, and infrastructure teams to align priorities and deliver features that delight our customers. This collaborative approach is at the heart of our success.

- Proven experience in backend systems at scale, ideally in Go.
- Strong understanding of distributed systems, APIs, and event ingestion pipelines.
- Demonstrated ability to navigate and improve existing large-scale codebases quickly.
- Experience leading cross-team projects with clear technical strategy and measurable outcomes.
- Track record of mentoring and uplifting engineering teams.

- Experience with GCP and Kubernetes in production environments.
- Exposure to React, Typescript, and Ruby on Rails.
- Familiarity with analytics, telemetry, or personalization data flows.
- Experience in migrating or re-architecting existing systems.

- GRIT - Problem-solving and perseverance capability in an ever-changing and growing environment.
- TRUST - Willingness to trust our co-workers and to take ownership.
- CANDOR - Ability to receive and give constructive feedback.
- CARE - Genuine care about other team members, our clients and the decisions we make in the company.
- HUMILITY - Aptitude for learning from others, putting ego aside.

- Our open positions may appear on third-party job boards, but the best way to apply safely is directly through our careers page.
- All genuine communication from Algolia will come from an @algolia.com email address. If you receive an email from someone claiming to work at Algolia who does not have an @algolia.com email address, please do not respond or share any personal information.
- We’ll never ask for payments, purchases, or financial details during the hiring process.

ALPHA Augmented is a Swiss startup using AI and advanced optimization algorithms to transform logistics. Our solutions help Fortune 500 companies cut logistics costs by over 20% while reducing CO₂ emissions through smarter packing and freight utilization. Join a mission-driven team where innovation meets impact, transforming global supply chains for a sustainable future.



Role Summary

As Head of Engineering , you lead ALPHA Augmented’s engineering organization , driving the development of our AI-driven logistics platform . In close partnership with the CEO and COO , you translate business and customer requirements into a focused technology roadmap, oversee architecture and infrastructure, and scale a high-performing engineering team. You are accountable for the company’s technology strategy, reliability, security, and cost efficiency , as well as for fostering an engineering culture that delivers measurable business impact.

This is a unique opportunity to lead a proven technology organization that already serves live enterprise customers and to elevate our platform, processes, and engineering practices to enterprise-grade quality and reliability. Your mandate is to sharpen focus, accelerate delivery, and grow people while strengthening ALPHA’s IP and data assets.



Your Responsibilities

- Develop and implement ALPHA’s technology and data strategies in line with company goals.
- Translate business and customer needs into an outcome-driven technology roadmap.
- Own system architecture and cloud infrastructure; select the tech stack, make build-vs-buy decisions, and manage vendors.
- Define and uphold engineering standards for code quality, testing, CI/CD, observability, security, and documentation.
- Ensure platform reliability, scalability, and performance through monitoring, incident reviews, and continuous improvement.
- Lead, coach, and retain a high-performing engineering organization that operates with clarity, accountability, and continuous improvement.
- Manage the full recruitment pipeline for engineering roles, from sourcing to onboarding.
- Collaborate with Operations and Commercial teams to align priorities, delivery timelines, and business outcomes.
- Engage with key customers on integrations, performance, and security topics to inform technical direction.
- Oversee budgets and drive cost-efficient architectural and operational decisions.
- Plan and manage system changes and upgrades to minimize disruption and technical risk.
- Maintain a strong security posture and ensure compliance with internal and customer requirements.



Your Qualifications

- 8+ years of experience in software, data, or platform engineering, including several years in a senior leadership role.
- Proven ability to define and execute technology strategy that supports measurable business outcomes.
- Strong architectural judgment across modern web platforms, APIs, data systems, and cloud infrastructure (preferably Azure).
- Experience leading cross-functional engineering teams across backend, frontend, data, and algorithms.
- Deep understanding of security, networking, and compliance in cloud environments, including identity, secrets, network boundaries, and SDLC controls.
- Track record of improving delivery performance through strong process design, documentation, and clear technical standards.
- Demonstrated success hiring, developing, and retaining high-performing engineers and technical leads.
- Experience managing budgets, vendor relationships, and cost optimization without compromising quality.
- Hands-on familiarity with modern development practices (CI/CD, observability, IaC) and a pragmatic approach to technical debt.
- Excellent communication skills ; able to translate between business, logistics, and technical domains.

Nice to Have

- Background in logistics, optimization, operations research, or machine learning .
- Experience with data governance, MDM, and analytics platforms for enterprise customers.



How You’ll Work

- Remote-first, CET-aligned. Collaboration hours optimized for deep work and team overlap.
- Startup pace. Intensity varies by phase; we communicate clearly and solve problems together.

- Take a leadership role in cross-functional teams to create data standard driven end-to-end processes and solutions that support the scientific need of a study/program while ensuring quality, consistency and compliance to CDISC standards and regulatory requirements.
- Serve as a subject matter expert on all aspects of clinical data standards development that includes industry standards and regulations.
- Set up, lead or/and contribute actively in the Data Standards Governance meetings.
- Provide support to optimize data acquisition in clinical trials by exploring opportunities to streamline and integrate data, enhancing efficiency and data quality.
- Support and implement future strategies and technology-enabled processes and tools for clinical trials standards, change control management and the exchange of standards information to internal and external stakeholders.
- Keep abreast of Industry and Regulatory Authority requirements related to data standards and data submission, interpret published data standards guidance documentation and perform impact assessments to decide on a strategy for implementation

- Develop and maintain the argenx Clinical Data Standards library
- Support CDM and DML in creation of study specific unique CRFs and SDTM metadata, implementing clinical data standards on trial level
- Ensure proper training of the CDM and other internal teams in the use of the argenx clinical data standards. Support CDM with review of the SDTM conversion and data QC on trial level.
- Perform proper issue escalation to other members of the CTT and/or Indication Development Team (IDT) as required

- Lead/participate in initiatives on process improvements focussed on data standardization
- Participate in regulatory agency inspections and internal audits, when appropriate

- Knowledge of ICH-GCP and other applicable legislation
- CDISC standards (SDTM, CDASH)
- Eye for detail, analytical skills
- Able to work independently
- Strong communication and interpersonal skills
- Fluent in English (written and spoken)

- Master’s or Bachelor’s degree in Life Sciences, Information Technology or equivalent by experience
- At least 8 years experience in Clinical Data Management (Biotech experience is a plus)
- Experience of working in a Data Standards team
- In depth understanding of Clinical Development processes
- Good knowledge of the applicable regulatory guidelines

Per un progetto imprenditoriale ambito aste on-line tra privati sto cercando uno/due co-founder. Non abbiamo competitor perché noi non faremo aste online di beni immobiliari ma di oggetti presenti nelle case di ognuno di noi.

Ogni pezzo può essere con prezzo di riserva oppure senza prezzo di riserva a partire da 1€. Per oggetti di “valore” ci avvaleremo di esperti per la valutazione andando proprio a casa del Cliente per la valutazione del bene.

Il pagamento avviene attraverso la piattaforma è innovativo (concrete opportunità di essere iscritti nel registro delle startup innovative). Il progetto è definitivo ma si ricercano persone in grado di dare quel quid e valore aggiunto all’idea.



LAVORI FATTI:

1) Indagini sul mercato delle aste

2) Sondaggi fatti di persona (per lo più ad amici e ne ho raggranellati una 50ina)

3) Business model canvas

4) Analisi SWOT

5) Marketing plan

6) Funzionalità piattaforma (per web agency) e descrizione progetto (discorsivo per tutti)



COMPOSIZIONE TEAM:

1) Fondatore ed ideatore (ho lavorato nel mondo delle aste di immobili con e senza incanto)

2) Possibile partner di una società di aste



CHI STO CERCANDO?

Sto cercando due co-founder in grado di:

1) dare una visione strategica all’azienda

2) ottimizzare l’idea portando valore aggiunto e portarla sul mercato

3) rappresentare l’azienda con gli stakeholders cercando di far conoscere e rafforzare il brand sempre di più

4) tutte quelle mansioni previste per un socio fondatore con suddivisione equa di quote



E’ gradito chi ha esperienza nel mondo startup e in maniera particolare nel mondo delle aste/valutazioni.

job title: Führungskräfte (m/w/d) selbstständig - sehr viel Homeoffice möglich

Nous accompagnons les agences immobilières et mandataires à augmenter leur prise de mandats grâce à un système de prospection basé sur Meta Ads, associé à un accompagnement complet.



Nous générons quotidiennement des leads entrants qualifiés .

Missions :

- Appels de closing sur leads déjà qualifiés (pas de prospection)
- Gestion du suivi commercial dans le CRM
- Compte-rendus structurés
- Participation ponctuelle à l'amélioration du script et du process de vente

Rémunération :



Phase de démarrage :



- 1 000€ fixe / mois
- 300€ par vente

Après 20 ventes cumulées :



- 1 000€ fixe / mois
- 350€ par vente
- + Bonus de 300€ chaque palier de 10 ventes mensuelles franchi

Revenu moyen attendu : 4 000€ à 8 000€ / mois selon performance.



Si vous correspondez au profil et souhaitez rejoindre une structure sérieuse, performante et en croissance, merci de m’envoyer une présentation rapide de votre expérience.

Responsibilities

1. Market Expansion and Business Development

1.1 Conduct in - depth research on the aviation temperature - controlled container rental market and accurately identify potential business opportunities. Develop and implement effective market penetration strategies to gradually increase the company's market share among key customer groups such as airlines, freight forwarders, and pharmaceutical companies.

1.2 Actively participate in industry exhibitions, seminars, etc., to expand business networks and enhance the company's visibility and influence in the local market.

1.3 Build and maintain long - term and stable cooperative relationships with key-account in the region.

1.4 Collaborate with HQ teams to develop personalized rental solutions based on customer needs, enhancing customer experience and loyalty.

2. Sales and Performance Achievement

2.1 Set clear sales targets for the country or region and formulate detailed sales plans. Regularly analyze and forecast sales performance, and adjust sales strategies in a timely manner to ensure the achievement of sales targets.

2.2 Take charge of the entire sales process, including prospecting, sales presentations, contract negotiation and signing. Actively explore new customers to promote business growth.

3. Team Leadership and Management

3.1 Lead and manage the sales and support teams in the country or region. Provide professional guidance and training to team members, conduct regular performance evaluations and feedback, and motivate team members to achieve individual and team goals.

3.2 Create a positive and collaborative work atmosphere, encourage team innovation, and improve the overall work efficiency and execution ability of the team.

4. Compliance and Risk Management

Ensure that the company's business operations in the country or region strictly comply with local laws, regulations, and internal company policies. Identify and assess potential business risks and formulate corresponding risk response measures.



Qualifications

1.A bachelor's degree in business administration, logistics management, aviation management, or a related field. A master's degree is preferred.

2.At least 5  years of experience in sales, business development, or management in the aviation, freight forwarder, or pharmaceutical industry. Experience in the aviation temperature - controlled container rental business is preferred.

3.Fluent in English, with excellent listening, speaking, reading, and writing abilities. Proficient for business communication and negotiation.

4. In - depth understanding of the aviation and global logistics markets, local business cultures, regulatory policies, and customer preferences.

5.Strong customer service awareness and rich experience in customer relationship management.

6.Excellent leadership and team management skills.

job title: Senior DevOps Engineer * - Smart City Open Source
description:
Teilzeit oder Vollzeit (30 – 40 Stunden) | Startdatum: zumnächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt | Remote

Städte smarter, nachhaltiger + sicherer zu machen, ist Teil deiner Mission? Unsere auch! Bewirb dich als Senior DevOps Engineer * um Teil unseres Start-ups zu werden und die Mission in die Tat umzusetzen!

- Gestalte aktiv die Zukunft eines jungen und innovativen Unternehmens mit Fokus auf Open Source und nachnutzbare Softwarelösungen mit.
- Bringe deine Begeisterung für Smart Home oder Automatisierung auf das nächste Level und unterstütze unsere Kunden mit Fokus auf Smart Cities bei der Lösung von Herausforderungen in vielfältigen Bereichen, wie z.B. Datenmanagement, Mobilität, Energie und Klima.​
- Konzipiere gemeinsam mit einem starken Team innovative Softwarearchitekturen und implementiere sie mit der Nutzung von aktuellen Technologien.
- Begleite den gesamten Lebenszyklus der entstehenden Lösungen ​– vom Prototypen bis zum Produktiveinsatz.​
- Remote-Arbeit nicht nur als Option, sondern als feste Unternehmenskultur.

Must-Haves

- Mind. 3 Jahre Berufserfahrung in der IT, optimalerweise mit Fokus auf Entwicklung und Betrieb von Software
- Du hast ein Studium der Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Elektrotechnik oder eine IT-bezogene Ausbildung abgeschlossen. Quereinsteiger mit passenden Weiterbildungen oder zusätzlicher Berufserfahrung ebenfalls möglich.
- Deutsch beherrscht Du mind. auf C1 Niveau und kannst es erfolgreich im Berufsalltag verwenden
- Kontakt mit Kunden ist für dich kein Problem und Du bist bereit Schulungen und Workshops zu leiten (unregelmäßig ca. 2x pro Monat - Remote)
- Du hast bereits DevOps-Tools benutzt, mit Microservices in der Cloud gearbeitet und kennst dich im agilen Entwicklungsumfeld aus
- Erfahrungen im Umgang mit Software as a Service, Containern, Kubernetes oder automatisiertem Deployment, gerne auch in privaten Projekten.
- Deine analytischen Fähigkeiten machen es dir einfach, dich schnell in neue Projekte einzubringen und gemeinsam mit Kunden passgenaue Lösungen zu entwickeln
- Du bringst Begeisterung für die systematische Lösungsfindung von technischen Herausforderungen mit. Treu nach dem Prinzip: Geht nicht, gibt’s (eigentlich) nicht!

Idealerweise

- hast du schon Erfahrungen mit Open Source durch eigene Projekte gesammelt
- entwickelst du in verschiedenen Skripten oder Sprachen wie z. B. Java, JavaScript, Python, Go, C# oder auch Shell Scripts und bist motiviert, dich schnell in neue Programmiersprachen einzuarbeiten.
- CI/CD, GitOps, Helm, Ansible oder Terraform sind dir nicht komplett fremd.
- hast du kein Problem damit, auch mal einen Bereitschaftsdienst am Wochenende zu übernehmen (nur tagsüber und mit Vergütung)

Wir bieten dir

- hoch aktuelle, spannende Herausforderungen in einer Arbeitsumgebung mit neuesten Technologien, flachen Organisationsstrukturen und kurzen Entscheidungswegen.
- die Möglichkeit, schnell Verantwortung zu übernehmen und am Erfolg des Unternehmens direkt zu partizipieren.
- eine Start-Up Umgebung, wo wir alle eng zusammenarbeiten.
- soziale Nachhaltigkeit durch unseren Fokus auf Open Source Entwicklungen.
- öffentliche Auftraggeber mit Smart City Projekten, die unseren Alltag nachhaltig verändern werden.

Benefits, über die du dich bald freuen kannst

- Bei uns bist du nicht an einen Standort gebunden und kannst innerhalb von Deutschland überall arbeiten ( 100% Home Office )
- Gleichzeitig hast Du die Möglichkeit Hybrid zu arbeiten, wenn dir das wichtig ist. (Wir können dir, über die UNITY Innovation Alliance, Standorte in Berlin, Hamburg, München, Frankfurt am Main, Stuttgart, Nürnberg oder Paderborn/Lippstadt anbieten)
- 28 Urlaubstage für deine Erholung
- Vor Ort Events , um unseren Team-Spirit zu stärken
- Wir bieten dir persönliches Coaching & Mentoring für deinen perfekten Start in die Arbeitswelt.
- Ein umfassendes Lernmanagement System , mit dem Du dich persönlich und fachlich weiterentwickeln kannst.
- Mitarbeiter Rabatte über unseren Corporate Benefits Partner
- Und selbstverständlich wirst du mit einem eigenen Laptop ausgestattet.* Bei uns ist jede:r unabhängig von Herkunft, Geschlecht, sexueller Orientierung, Handicap, Religion und Alter willkommen.

HYPERTEGRITY entwickelt innovative, hoch zuverlässige und sichere Lösungen für Smart Cities und urbane Daten – von IoT-Sensornetzen bis zu automatisierten Plattform-Infrastrukturen in der Cloud. Unsere Produkte basieren auf über 20 Jahren Erfahrung in der Entwicklung und dem Betrieb verteilter Systeme.

Wir arbeiten umfassend nach dem Open Source Grundsatz und veröffentlichen gemeinsam mit unseren Kunden unsere Softwareentwicklungen. Wir sind Teil der UNITY Innovation Alliance, die Unternehmen mit umfassender Expertise bei der Digitalisierung von Geschäftsmodellen, Produkten und Services begleitet.

Wenn du Lust hast, in unserem Team zu arbeiten und HYPERTEGRITY mit uns weiterzuentwickeln, dann bewirb dich jetzt!

Role Description

This is a contract remote role for AI/LLM Trainer (Italian language Specialist) at MillionLogics. This position is within a project with one of the reputed clients, which is an LLM company based in the USA. The goal is to assist the clients in enhancing their large language models.



One way we help these companies improve their models is by providing them with high-quality proprietary data. This data serves two main purposes: first, as a basis for fine-tuning their models, and second, as an evaluation set to benchmark the performance of their models or competitor models.



For example, in the case of Agent Completion (AC) data generation, your task will be to simulate high-quality multi-turn conversations between a user and a smart assistant that utilises function-calling tools to accomplish user goals. You will craft these dialogues by playing both the assistant and the user, while simulating tool use where necessary to guide the assistant through complex decision-making and real-world reasoning scenarios.



What does day-to-day look like:

- Design multi-turn conversations that simulate real interactions between users and AI assistants using apps like Calendar, email, maps, and Drive.
- Emulate both the user and the assistant, including the assistant's tool calls (only when corrections are needed).
- Carefully select when and how the assistant uses available tools, ensuring logical flow and proper usage of function calls.
- Craft dialogues that demonstrate natural language, intelligent behaviour, and contextual understanding across multiple turns.
- Generate examples that showcase the assistant’s ability to gracefully complete feasible tasks, recognise infeasible ones, and maintain engaging general chat when tools aren’t required.
- Ensure all conversations adhere to defined formatting and quality guidelines, using an internal playbook.
- Iterate on conversation examples based on feedback to continuously improve realism, clarity, and value for training purposes.
- Collaborate with peers and reviewers to maintain consistency and high standards in deliverables.



Requirements:

- 3+ years of overall professional experience in a technical or analytical field
- Experience in any programming language or tech stack is acceptable; a strong grasp of APIs, data formats (e.g., JSON), and logical thinking is more critical than specific toolsets
- Strong general technical reasoning skills and the ability to model real-world assistant behaviour using tool-based APIs
- Ability to break down complex tasks and simulate realistic dialogues that reflect user expectations and assistant limitations
- Excellent written communication skills in English, with a focus on clarity, tone, and instructional coherence
- Creativity and attention to detail in crafting realistic scenarios and responses
- Experience working with or around LLMs, virtual assistants, or function-calling frameworks is a plus.
- Ability to follow detailed guidelines and formatting standards with high consistency
- Excellent English communication and interpersonal skills
- Ability to work independently and remotely
- Native or professional proficiency in Italian and English languages



Perks of Working With MillionLogics:

- Work in a fully remote environment
- Opportunity to work on cutting-edge AI projects with a leading LLM client based in the U.S.
